intro: Eleutherococcus leucorrhizus var. brevipedunculatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed Siberian ginseng, is a deciduous shrub native to the forests of eastern Russia and northeastern China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces red berries that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. It is valued for its adaptogenic properties and is often used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit and botanical features make it a distinctive member of its genus.
